messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] misspelling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/25/02 8:25:45 PM, marji@gaiawolf.org writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/25/02 8:25:45 PM, marji@... writes:

<< Believe it or not, though, I keep them all in a folder in case I
want to refer back to something or look something up. Are you sitting
down? (Of course you are; you're at your computer!) There are more than
12,000 messages in that folder! I'm a virtual pack-rat! <BG> >>

You can just go to yahoogroups and read the archives. (not as well organized
as your folders, maybe...)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] misspelling
messages.msgSnippet: ... I caught the misspelling of mispelling too late. LOL. But of course it should be misspelling . Enough already - I know.  Karin
messages.messageBody:
"Karin" <curtkar@...> wrote:

> I'm glad you cared to acknowledge the mispelling <g> and I'm glad I asked.


I caught the misspelling of "mispelling" too late. LOL.
But of course it should be "misspelling".
Enough already - I know. <g>

Karin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] misspelling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh!  But I LOVE when misspelling is misspelled!  It s probably one of the most misspelled words in our weirdo language! Well, I know what you mean,
messages.messageBody:
At 19:54 10/25/02 -0700, you wrote:

>"Karin" <curtkar@...> wrote:
>
> > I'm glad you cared to acknowledge the mispelling <g> and I'm glad I asked.
>
>
>I caught the misspelling of "mispelling" too late. LOL.
>But of course it should be "misspelling".
>Enough already - I know. <g>
>
>Karin

Oh! But I LOVE when 'misspelling' is misspelled! It's probably one of the
most misspelled words in our weirdo language!

Well, I know what you mean, Karin, about the challenge of keeping up with
this list lately. Some of these posts, lately, have been enough to curl my
hair! But, unfortunately I have to let some of the posts go by unread
because I don't have the time to read the volumes of mail, be with Liam,
work, sleep, eat, and do all that other stuff I'm supposed to be
doing. Believe it or not, though, I keep them all in a folder in case I
want to refer back to something or look something up. Are you sitting
down? (Of course you are; you're at your computer!) There are more than
12,000 messages in that folder! I'm a virtual pack-rat! <BG>

Anyway, it's fun talking!

With love,

Marji

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
